trans-unit.source: This is Iaan's test md page using VS2015.
trans-unit.target: This is Iaan's test md page using VS2015.

trans-unit.source: So what did I do?
trans-unit.target: So what did I do?

trans-unit.source: Here's some answers yo:
trans-unit.target: Here's some answers yo:

trans-unit.source: So you can check-in/check-out and manage files in the GitHub repos:
trans-unit.target: So you can check-in/check-out and manage files in the GitHub repos:

trans-unit.source: Install VS2015 and choose the 'custom' option.
trans-unit.target: Install VS2015 and choose the 'custom' option.

trans-unit.source: On the next screen, at the bottom, you need to select the two Git-related options.
trans-unit.target: On the next screen, at the bottom, you need to select the two Git-related options.

trans-unit.source: So you can see a preview of your .md files in VS2015:
trans-unit.target: So you can see a preview of your .md files in VS2015:

trans-unit.source: Install [VS Web Essentials](http://vswebessentials.com/download "Link to download the latest Web Essentials version - you can also search for it in the extensions manager in VS").
trans-unit.target: Install [VS Web Essentials](http://vswebessentials.com/download "Link to download the latest Web Essentials version - you can also search for it in the extensions manager in VS").

trans-unit.source: To understand more about how to use GitHub and VS2015, check these out:
trans-unit.target: To understand more about how to use GitHub and VS2015, check these out:

trans-unit.source: WDG-CPUB test instructions
trans-unit.target: WDG-CPUB test instructions

trans-unit.source: The WDG repo on github.com
trans-unit.target: The WDG repo on github.com

trans-unit.source: Preview (and live) version of the WDG repo on MSDN
trans-unit.target: Preview (and live) version of the WDG repo on MSDN

trans-unit.source: Channel 9 guide to connecting GitHub repos to VS2015
trans-unit.target: Channel 9 guide to connecting GitHub repos to VS2015

trans-unit.source: Tutorial on creating a GitHub project
trans-unit.target: Tutorial on creating a GitHub project

trans-unit.source: Here's what we're going to do in our little excursion
trans-unit.target: Here's what we're going to do in our little excursion

trans-unit.source: 1.1 Make changes and review them all on github.com
trans-unit.target: 1.1 Make changes and review them all on github.com

trans-unit.source: Go to the wdg-cpub-test repo on github.com and navigate to the readme.md file
trans-unit.target: Go to the wdg-cpub-test repo on github.com and navigate to the readme.md file

trans-unit.source: Make an update on the site to include this URL for msdnstage:
trans-unit.target: Make an update on the site to include this URL for msdnstage:

trans-unit.source: https://msdnstage.redmond.corp.microsoft.com/wdg-cpub-test/HelloWorld
trans-unit.target: https://msdnstage.redmond.corp.microsoft.com/wdg-cpub-test/HelloWorld

trans-unit.source: Request a pull change
trans-unit.target: Request a pull change

trans-unit.source: 1.2a Use VS2015 to pull files from a repo
trans-unit.target: 1.2a Use VS2015 to pull files from a repo

trans-unit.source: Click the **Manage Connections** icon at the top of the **Team Explorer** window.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Manage Connections** icon at the top of the **Team Explorer** window.

trans-unit.source: You should see a GitHub section (if this doesn't appear, you may need to sign in first).
trans-unit.target: You should see a GitHub section (if this doesn't appear, you may need to sign in first).

trans-unit.source: Click **Clone** and search for a project (eg *wdg-cpub*) from the list.
trans-unit.target: Click **Clone** and search for a project (eg *wdg-cpub*) from the list.

trans-unit.source: Make sure it's going in your dedicated GitHub syncs folder.
trans-unit.target: Make sure it's going in your dedicated GitHub syncs folder.

trans-unit.source: Click **Clone**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Clone**.

trans-unit.source: This will pull all the files in the repo onto your local machine.
trans-unit.target: This will pull all the files in the repo onto your local machine.

trans-unit.source: Use File Explorer to go to the location of the repo and you can see the files.
trans-unit.target: Use File Explorer to go to the location of the repo and you can see the files.

trans-unit.source: You can copy the files to somewhere else on your machine to open them and play around with them without fear that you will make changes on the server.
trans-unit.target: You can copy the files to somewhere else on your machine to open them and play around with them without fear that you will make changes on the server.

trans-unit.source: 1.2b Use VS2015 to push files to a repo
trans-unit.target: 1.2b Use VS2015 to push files to a repo

trans-unit.source: To make changes appear on the server, open up the file from within your local folder and make the changes.
trans-unit.target: To make changes appear on the server, open up the file from within your local folder and make the changes.

trans-unit.source: Save the file and go back to VS2015.
trans-unit.target: Save the file and go back to VS2015.

trans-unit.source: Generally, you should make branches when you are making changes.
trans-unit.target: Generally, you should make branches when you are making changes.

trans-unit.source: See [Team Workflow for more information](https://msdnstage.redmond.corp.microsoft.com/en-us/wdg-cpub-test/tedhudek/workflow).
trans-unit.target: See [Team Workflow for more information](https://msdnstage.redmond.corp.microsoft.com/en-us/wdg-cpub-test/tedhudek/workflow).

trans-unit.source: Click the **Manage Connections** icon at the top of the **Team Explorer** window.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Manage Connections** icon at the top of the **Team Explorer** window.

trans-unit.source: You should see a GitHub section (if this doesn't appear, you may need to sign in first).
trans-unit.target: You should see a GitHub section (if this doesn't appear, you may need to sign in first).

trans-unit.source: Double-click the repo you want to update in the list of **Local Git Respositories**.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the repo you want to update in the list of **Local Git Respositories**.

trans-unit.source: This will open the repo and take you to **Team Explorer**.
trans-unit.target: This will open the repo and take you to **Team Explorer**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Branches**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Branches**.

trans-unit.source: right click on *master* and click *New local branch from...*.
trans-unit.target: right click on *master* and click *New local branch from...*.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for the new branch (describing what you did or the date maybe).
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for the new branch (describing what you did or the date maybe).

trans-unit.source: Click **Create Branch**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create Branch**.

trans-unit.source: Go to **Changes**.
trans-unit.target: Go to **Changes**.

trans-unit.source: You'll see the files you updated, and the new branch should be selected by default.
trans-unit.target: You'll see the files you updated, and the new branch should be selected by default.

trans-unit.source: If not, click on the branch name, which will take you to **Branches**.
trans-unit.target: If not, click on the branch name, which will take you to **Branches**.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the new branch, then go back to **Changes**.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the new branch, then go back to **Changes**.

trans-unit.source: Enter a description and click **Commit**.
trans-unit.target: Enter a description and click **Commit**.

trans-unit.source: Go to **Sync**.
trans-unit.target: Go to **Sync**.

trans-unit.source: You'll see the an open publish request.
trans-unit.target: You'll see the an open publish request.

trans-unit.source: Click **Publish**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Publish**.

trans-unit.source: Your local changes are now on the github.com server.
trans-unit.target: Your local changes are now on the github.com server.

trans-unit.source: You can go there to see them.
trans-unit.target: You can go there to see them.

trans-unit.source: 1.3 Use VS2015 to do it all (connect to a github repo, make changes, sync with github.com)
trans-unit.target: 1.3 Use VS2015 to do it all (connect to a github repo, make changes, sync with github.com)

trans-unit.source: Click the **Manage Connections** icon at the top of the **Team Explorer** window.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Manage Connections** icon at the top of the **Team Explorer** window.

trans-unit.source: You should see a GitHub section (if this doesn't appear, you may need to sign in first).
trans-unit.target: You should see a GitHub section (if this doesn't appear, you may need to sign in first).

trans-unit.source: You have two options, which depend on whether you've created a repo on github.com already and want to use it, or if you want to create a new repo right now:
trans-unit.target: You have two options, which depend on whether you've created a repo on github.com already and want to use it, or if you want to create a new repo right now:

trans-unit.source: Under GitHub, click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Under GitHub, click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the name, a description, the local sync path you want to use (it's a good idea to keep all your syncs in one folder, on a non-OS partition).
trans-unit.target: Enter the name, a description, the local sync path you want to use (it's a good idea to keep all your syncs in one folder, on a non-OS partition).

trans-unit.source: Click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: In this example we'll use *Testing* for the name, and *F:\Gits* for the path.
trans-unit.target: In this example we'll use *Testing* for the name, and *F:\Gits* for the path.

trans-unit.source: If you have an existing repo, click **Clone* and select it from the list. Click **Clone**.
trans-unit.target: If you have an existing repo, click **Clone* and select it from the list. Click **Clone**.

trans-unit.source: Your repo will appear in the list of **Local Git Respositories**.
trans-unit.target: Your repo will appear in the list of **Local Git Respositories**.

trans-unit.source: Double-click it to open the repo in **Team Explorer**.
trans-unit.target: Double-click it to open the repo in **Team Explorer**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Solutions** click **New...**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Solutions** click **New...**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Templates\Other Project Types\Visual Studio Solutions** select Blank Solution, give it the same name as the repo you just created: *Testing*.
trans-unit.target: Under **Templates\Other Project Types\Visual Studio Solutions** select Blank Solution, give it the same name as the repo you just created: *Testing*.

trans-unit.source: Change the **Location** to be the parent folder of the repo you just created: *F:\Gits*.
trans-unit.target: Change the **Location** to be the parent folder of the repo you just created: *F:\Gits*.

trans-unit.source: Select **Add to source control** and click OK.
trans-unit.target: Select **Add to source control** and click OK.

trans-unit.source: Go to Changes, enter a description and click Commit.
trans-unit.target: Go to Changes, enter a description and click Commit.

trans-unit.source: Go to Sync.
trans-unit.target: Go to Sync.

trans-unit.source: You'll see an open push request.
trans-unit.target: You'll see an open push request.

trans-unit.source: Click **Push**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Push**.

trans-unit.source: You've now created a repo on github.com, and synced it with your local copy.
trans-unit.target: You've now created a repo on github.com, and synced it with your local copy.

trans-unit.source: It only contains a readme.md, but if you go to github.com, you'll see the repo has been created.
trans-unit.target: It only contains a readme.md, but if you go to github.com, you'll see the repo has been created.

trans-unit.source: Now you can start working on files.
trans-unit.target: Now you can start working on files.

trans-unit.source: Go to the **Solution Explorer** in VS2015.
trans-unit.target: Go to the **Solution Explorer** in VS2015.

trans-unit.source: Here you'll see the files you have.
trans-unit.target: Here you'll see the files you have.

trans-unit.source: Right-click to add a new file, choose a text document, and call it whatever you want.
trans-unit.target: Right-click to add a new file, choose a text document, and call it whatever you want.

trans-unit.source: Make sure it has .md as the extension (this ensures it is a MarkDown document).
trans-unit.target: Make sure it has .md as the extension (this ensures it is a MarkDown document).

trans-unit.source: You can now edit it in VS2015.
trans-unit.target: You can now edit it in VS2015.

trans-unit.source: To push your changes, go to **Team Explorer**, then follow Steps 8 and 9 in Section 1.3 above.
trans-unit.target: To push your changes, go to **Team Explorer**, then follow Steps 8 and 9 in Section 1.3 above.
